intro: Randia caracasana, commonly known as the Caracas randia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a shrub that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually oval-shaped with a rough texture. Randia caracasana is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. It is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
